ILEC Conference Centre

Wednesday 15th October
10am – 2pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1756371188805{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Join this exclusive brunch designed to highlight the tenacity of talented Black women in business, entertainment, and creative industries. column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Charmaine Hayden

Cultural Commentator[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539427963{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Charmaine Hayden is the Founding Partner of GOODsoil VC, backing underrepresented founders across Europe and Africa. With a background spanning law, psychology, and entrepreneurship, she has co-founded platforms including the modelling agency Face4music, the women’s empowerment network Gold Digger, and the influential media platform Not For The Radio. Alongside her work in venture capital, Charmaine is also a respected cultural commentator, using her voice to spotlight equity, representation, and the intersections of business and culture.

Henrie Kwushue

DJ, Presenter & Broadcaster[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539486389{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Henrie Kwushue is a DJ, presenter, and broadcaster from Southeast London, best known for hosting KISS XTRA’s Drive Time Show and Spotify’s Who We Be Talks podcast. She is also the founder of HTK Productions, behind the acclaimed docu-series Is Your Area Changing and web series Untold Stories. With work spanning No Signal Radio to major stages for Nike, Adidas, and Puma, Henrie has been profiled by The Guardian, Dazed, and Glamour. Celebrated for her cultural insight and love of emerging sounds like afrobeats, UK rap, and R&B, Henrie is one of the leading voices in UK radio today.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Elizabeth Idowu

Midwife & Maternal Health Advocate[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539558509{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Mamadinya (Elizabeth Idowu) is a UK-based midwife, content creator, and maternal health advocate known for delivering pre- & postnatal care advice with warmth and humour. With a community of over 500,000 followers and more than 10 million impressions across her platforms, she is also the founder of MamasClasses, where she has taught thousands of pregnant women, and the creator of Bumps and Brunches, a live community event for expectant mothers. Through her work, Elizabeth bridges the gap in maternity education with honesty, humour, and cultural sensitivity, aiming to shift stigmas around pregnancy and empower women with the knowledge they deserve.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Rumbi Mupindu

Co-Founder & Talent Director, VAMP[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539635562{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Rumbi is a working mother of two beautiful girls and deeply understands the importance of how and why representation matters. This is why she is a big advocate for black working mums and dedicates her time to speaking on panels & creating opportunities at VAMP through an Internship programme. Rumbi is passionate about empowering the next generation of diverse talent. This co-founder shows she can really do it all, balancing working life and family life whilst paying it forward!

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Ruby Aryiku

Co-Founder & PR Director, VAMP[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539737850{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

As an advocate for representation and access, Ruby has been passionate about creating pathways into industries and spaces that aren’t always easy to reach. Having started work experience at the age of 15, she understands the importance of early exposure and access to opportunities, and now spends much of her time mentoring and nurturing creators, upcoming press, and new talent hoping to break into PR & Marketing. Ruby is currently a trustee on the Black British Initiative (BBI). Prior to founding VAMP, Ruby worked in Technology PR, Music PR and events.

Christina Okorocha

Co-Founder & Entertainment Director, VAMP[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1758539839053{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Christina is an entrepreneur and has a strong background in building impactful brand collaborations. She brings both strategic insight and a deep understanding of digital culture. Beyond her work at VAMP, Christina is passionate about career development and expanding access to opportunity, particularly for Black entrepreneurs and young people from underprivileged backgrounds who may not see certain career paths as accessible. She is committed to breaking down barriers and supporting small businesses and charities. Christina is an ambassador for the Mayor Fund for London and sits on charity boards.
